q: Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
h:
“Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: One must be deeply aware of the impermanence of the world.
h:
“One must be deeply aware of the impermanence of the world.” —
Dogen

q: Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs.
h:
“Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs. ” —
Henry Ford

q: To love means loving the unlovable.
h:
“To love means loving the unlovable.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: A man who cannot tolerate small misfortunes can never accomplish great things.
h:
“A man who cannot tolerate small misfortunes can never accomplish great things.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Successful people ask better questions, and as a result, they get better answers.
h:
“Successful people ask better questions, and as a result, they get better answers.” —
Tony Robbins

q: The world is a puzzle; no need to make sense out of it.
h:
“The world is a puzzle; no need to make sense out of it.” —
Socrates

q: The person who says something is impossible should not interrupt the person who is doing it.
h:
“The person who says something is impossible should not interrupt the person who is doing it.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: A heart is not judged by how much you love, but by how much you are loved by others.
h:
“A heart is not judged by how much you love, but by how much you are loved by others.” —
Judy Garland

q: All you need is passion. If you have a passion for something, you'll create the talent.
h:
“All you need is passion. If you have a passion for something, you'll create the talent.” —
Yanni

q: He who knows how to wait need make no concessions.
h:
“He who knows how to wait need make no concessions.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: If you're waiting until you feel talented enough to make it, you'll never make it.
h:
“If you're waiting until you feel talented enough to make it, you'll never make it.” —
Criss Jami
